name: El Centro Inc.
description: El Centro offers a range of services including dual-language preschool education, financial literacy programs, community health navigation, and vocational training. They are committed to enhancing communities and the lives of Latinos through educational, social, and economic opportunities
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: Guadalupe Centers
address: 1440 South Ranger Avenue, Kansas City, MO 64103 (Note: This is a primary address, they have multiple facilities.)
description: Established in 1919, Guadalupe Centers provides early childhood education, charter schools, workforce development, adult education, and youth recreation and after-school programs
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: Revolución Educativa (RevED)
description: RevED is dedicated to building sustained collective power in the Hispanic community around issues of education through policy work and community-led programming. They offer programs focused on digital literacy and advocacy training
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: Latinx Education Collaborative (LEC)
address: (No specific address listed, operates in partnership with RevED)
description: LEC is an advocacy organization focused on creating conditions for the advancement of Latino youth through policy work and community-led programming. They partner with organizations like Revolución Educativa
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: Kansas Hispanic Education & Development Foundation (KHEDF)
description: KHEDF provides resources to Hispanic students exploring post-secondary education and career readiness, offering scholarships and educational initiatives
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: The Greater Kansas City Hispanic Collaborative (GKCHC)
address: (No specific address listed, but serves the Greater Kansas City area)
description: GKCHC empowers the next generation through education and provides assistance for the professional advancement of Hispanics. Their programs include "Latinos of Tomorrow" for college preparation and "Young Latino Professionals" for networking and development
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: Children's Mercy – Adelante Kansas City & CHiCoS
description: These programs within Children's Mercy Hospital aim to reduce cultural and language barriers in healthcare and provide culturally competent care to the Latino community. While not direct academic tutoring, they support overall well-being which impacts educational success
services: Latino-owned Learning support in Kansas consultation

name: KC STEM Alliance
address: (No specific address listed, but serves the KC region)
description: While not exclusively Latino-owned, KC STEM Alliance focuses on ensuring access and equity to quality STEM experiences for all students, including those in the Latino community, through various programs and partnerships

name: Cultura Connections LLC
description: Cultura Connections specializes in Spanish instruction, language training, translation, and interpretation services, aiming to enhance cross-cultural communication for professionals and organizations

name: Alma A. (Wyzant Tutor)
address: Kansas City, MO (Online and in-person tutoring available)
description: Alma offers Spanish and Marketing tutoring, with a focus on conversational Spanish and academic support. She is a native Spanish speaker from Mexico who grew up in Kansas
